definition[0]: to add more liquid to a container that is partly full
example[0]: I’ll just top up the coffee pot.
definition[1]: to put more drink in someone’s glass or cup after they have drunk some
definition[2]: to increase the level of something slightly so as to bring it back to the level you want
example[2]: He had to do extra jobs at the weekend to top up his income.
definition[3]: an amount of liquid that you add to a glass, cup etc in order to make it full again
definition[4]: an extra payment that brings an amount to the desired level
definition[5]: to add to something in order to bring it up to the level you want
example[5]: You can top up your pension contributions any time.
definition[6]: an extra amount added to something in order to bring it up to the level you want
example[6]: Your bank may agree to provide the top-up needed to make a purchase possible.
